Body.p: Create and run your own virtual application server.

With "Virtual Server" mode enable, projects can run multiple instances from a single installation. These "virtual servers" separate data into different directories but all run from a single set of project files.
The active virtual server is stored within session variable. This information is used to direct data operations to the appropriate directory.
You should create a virtual server if:

ul.li: You want to test out the project
You want your project installation to be hosted and managed for you
You want to avoid installing, upgrading, and maintenance of projects
You want to be able to get started immediately (within minutes)

Body.p: You should install the project and run it with virtual servers enabled if:

ul.li: You want to give customers/clients the ability to create and run virtual servers within the project
You want to resell hosting related services

Body.p: You should not create a virtual server if:

ul.li: You want to customize your copy of the project
You want to run the project on your own server
